title: Ukraine Counteroffensive Is Grueling and Costly but Promising, U.S. Says
description: American and Ukrainian defense officials said the fight to dislodge dug-in Russian forces occupying southeastern Ukraine was expected to be brutal.

title: Canada Highway Crash: At Least 15 Killed in Manitoba Collision
description: A bus and a semitruck collided on a rural stretch of the Trans-Canada Highway in Manitoba on Thursday, the police said.

title: Irma Capece Minutolo, Opera Singer and Partner to Exiled King, Dies at 87
description: The former Naples beauty queen became famous as the companion to the playboy Farouk I of Egypt, then carved out a successful opera career.

title: In Liberated Villages, Ukrainian Troops Still Face Lethal Threats
description: The Ukrainian counteroffensive has enjoyed some early successes, but with every step forward, the soldiers are increasingly exposed to Russian firepower.

title: Trump and Johnson Were Accused of Breaking Rules. One Lost Party Support.
description: Donald J. Trump and Boris Johnson are at the heart of political tempests at home, facing different accusations and far different results.

title: Brutal Killing of Governor Heralds New Round of Violence in Darfur
description: The United Nations blamed Sudanese paramilitaries for the death of the governor of West Darfur, Khamis Abdullah Abakar. Sudan’s war has destabilized a fragile western region devastated by genocide in the early 2000s.

title: NATO defense chiefs vow to stand by Ukraine, pledging more air defenses and training for fighter pilots.
German Police Investigate Rammstein Singer Over Sexual Assault Accusations
description: Accusations against the band’s frontman had been swirling on social media and in reports by German news outlets for nearly two weeks.

title: Kenyan Cult Survivors, Still Refusing to Eat, Face Suicide Charges
description: Dozens of members rescued from a church whose pastor is accused of telling followers to starve themselves appeared in court. A judge sent them to rehab rather than jail to await another hearing.

title: Indian Politician and Ex-Wrestling Chief Charged With Sexual Harassment
description: The charges against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, follow months of protest by prominent female wrestlers, who complained that the authorities had turned a deaf ear to their allegations.

title: North Korea Fires 2 Ballistic Missiles
description: The launch of the short-range projectiles came the same day the United States and South Korean militaries conducted a joint live-fire drill.

title: Pope Francis Will Leave Hospital on Friday, Vatican Says
description: The Vatican described the pope’s recovery nine days after undergoing abdominal surgery as “regular.”

title: Glenda Jackson, Oscar-Winning Actress Turned Politician, Dies at 87
description: Ms. Jackson was a two-time Oscar winner who walked away from a successful acting career to become a member of the British Parliament, before then returning to the stage.

title: NATO Defense Ministers Discuss Long-Term Aid for Ukraine
description: Allies have spent billions of dollars to finance Ukraine’s military, and the war shows no signs of ending soon.

title: Russia-China Bond Is Closely Watched, and Fraught
description: The shows of bonhomie between the two leaders reflect the bond between Russia and China, which could become more fraught as Russian dependence deepens.

title: Trump and the Fun Factor
description: How his legal challenges play into his reputation as an entertainer.

title: Greece Continues Search for Migrants After Crowded Ship Capsizes
description: The authorities revised the official toll of the deadly shipwreck down by one, to 78, but there are fears that hundreds of people may be missing.

title: IAEA Chief Arrives at the Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Plant to Assess Safety
description: Rafael Mariano Grossi, the head of the United Nations’ atomic agency, is investigating conditions at the plant, which is held by Russian forces.

title: Election Probe in Thailand Targets Pita Limjaroenrat
description: Activists say the case against the candidate, Pita Limjaroenrat, is part of a broader effort to nullify election results and further erode democracy in Thailand.

title: TikTok, Shein and Other Companies Distance Themselves From China
description: Companies are moving headquarters and factories outside the country and cleaving off their Chinese businesses. It’s not clear the strategy will work.

title: Boris Johnson Misled Parliament Over Covid Lockdown Parties, Report Says
description: The report offered a damning verdict on Boris Johnson, the former British prime minister, who quit Parliament last week.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: U.S. nuclear negotiations with Iran.

title: Key Environmentalists Back Biden, Despite Broken Oil Promises
description: Four major environmental groups are endorsing President Biden’s re-election bid, but some climate activists say his approval of drilling projects has been a betrayal.
